channel.title: Ha Young Kim | Computational Imaging and AI in Medicine

item.title: Five papers accepted at ISBI 2026 Main Conference
item.description:
• Covariance Descriptors Meet General Vision Encoders: Riemannian Deep Learning for Medical Image Classification
    Josef Mayr, Anna Reithmeir, Maxime Di Folco, Julia Schnabel
    (https://arxiv.org/abs/2511.04190)

  • LocBAM: Advancing 3D Patch-Based Image Segmentation by Integrating Location Context
    Donnate Hooft, Stefan Fischer, Cosmin Bercea, Jan Peeken, Julia Schnabel
    (https://arxiv.org/abs/2601.14802)

  • Learning to Reason About Rare Diseases Through Retrieval-Augmented Agents
    Ha Young Kim, Jun Li, Ana Beatriz Solana, Carolin Pirkl, Benedikt Wiestler, Julia Schnabel, Cosmin Bercea
    (https://arxiv.org/abs/2511.04720)



  • Measuring and Aligning Abstraction in Vision-Language Models with Medical Taxonomies
    Ben Schaper1, Maxime Di Folco, Bernhard Kainz, Julia Schnabel, Cosmin Bercea
    (https://arxiv.org/abs/2601.14827)



  • Uncertainty-guided Generation of Dark-field Radiographs
    Lina Felsner, Henriette Bast, Tina Dorosti, Florian Schaff, Franz Pfeiffer, Daniela Pfeiffer, Julia Schnabel
    (http://arxiv.org/abs/2601.15859)

item.title: Four abstracts accepted at 2025 ISMRM & ISMRT Annual Meeting
item.description:
Four abstracts from our group have been accepted at the 2025 ISMRM & ISMRT Annual Meeting.

  • Hannah Eichhorn will present her work “Leveraging Acquisition Knowledge to Enhance Robustness of Physics-Informed Motion Correction for T2* Quantification” as an oral power pitch on Monday, 12 May 2025 at 4 pm HAST.

  • Hannah Eichhorn will additionally present her work “Assessing the Influence of Preprocessing on the Agreement of Image Quality Metrics with Radiological Evaluation in the Presence of Motion” as an oral power pitch on Monday, 12 May 2025 at 4 pm HAST. Hannah’s abstract received a MAGNA CUM LAUDE Merit Award.

  • Natascha Niessen will present her work “Probing the sparsity of the MPnRAGE sequence through subspace compression” as a digital poster on Thursday, 15 May 2025 at 2:15 pm HAST.

  • Ha Young Kim will present her work “Deep learning enabled fast free-breathing stack-of-stars multiparameter mapping for fully quantitative analysis of prostate carcinoma” as a digital poster on Monday, 12 May 2025 at 5 pm HAST.
